revised_title: Extraocular Muscle Afferents and their Influence on Neck Muscle Activity during Vestibulocollic Reflex
tldr: The study investigates how afferent signals from pigeon extraocular muscles affect the activity of neck muscles during the vestibulocollic reflex. The results show that changes in eye position have significant effects on neck muscle electromyographic activity, suggesting that extraocular muscle afferent signals play a role in head-eye coordination.
